title: British nationals tell of 'surreal' Lebanon evacuation
description: Student Isobel Taper says it feels "surreal" being back in the UK, having left her boyfriend and cats in Beirut.

title: Watch: Jeremy Bowen presses Hamas deputy leader on 7 October attacks
description: One of the most senior leaders of Hamas - a group designated a terrorist organisation by the UK and others - speaks to the BBC's Jeremy Bowen.

title: MPs to get first vote on assisted dying for nine years
description: They will consider proposals to change the law so some terminally-ill people can choose to end their life.

title: UK hands back Chagos Islands - but will keep military base
description: In a historic move, the UK gives up sovereignty of a strategic group of islands to Mauritius - after decades of often fractious negotiations.

title: Mother guilty over fire deaths of four sons she left at home while shopping
description: Deveca Rose's two sets of twins died in a house fire while she was out shopping.

title: Yazidi woman rescued from Gaza after decade in captivity
description: The woman had been kidnapped from Iraq aged 11 by the Islamic State group and trafficked to Gaza.

title: Helene is deadliest mainland US hurricane since Katrina
description: Hundreds of people are still missing and nearly a million homes are without power a week after the storm tore across the US south-east.

title: GCSE students to continue receiving Covid exam help
description: The education secretary says equation sheets should be available to students sitting exams in 2025, 2026 and 2027.

title: Google introduces new way to search - pointing camera and asking questions
description: It is the latest move from the tech giant to change how people search online using artificial intelligence.

title: Sharp rise in vaping among young adults who've never smoked
description: A million adults have started vaping despite never having been regular smokers, scientists estimate.

title: Arrest made over acid attack on girl at London school
description: Teagan McFarlane, who is 14, remains in hospital with "potentially life-changing" injuries and has undergone surgery.

title: Israel-Hezbollah conflict in maps: Where is the fighting happening in Lebanon?
description: A visual guide to the latest developments in the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah.

title: Israel has vowed to punish Iran for its missile strikes. How?
description: Israel is set to retaliate for Iran's missile attack, while Tehran says it will hit back in turn if this happens.

title: Video shows Iranian missiles fired over Israel
description: Video filmed from Dabouq shows the barrage of missiles which were launched on 1 October.

title: Missile attack on Israel lays bare deep divisions among Iranians
description: Social media users express a mixture of pride, uncertainty and fear after Iran's strike on Israel.

title: Five takeaways from new filing in Trump election case
description: Trump allegedly said it didn't matter if he won or lost 2020 election, he would still "fight like hell".

title: Chagossians criticise lack of say in UK deal to hand over islands
description: Chagossians claim they were repeatedly refused the chance to take part in negotiations behind the historic deal.

title: TikTok influencer 'Mr Prada' arrested for second degree murder
description: He is accused of killing a 69-year-old Louisiana therapist, whose body was found by police on Sunday.

title: 'My wife had cancer but was misdiagnosed on the phone'
description: Laura Barlow "could have lived for longer" had she been seen face-to-face, her husband believes.

title: Faisal Islam: Oil price rise comes at a critical point
description: Any extended rise raises the possibility of higher petrol prices and gas and electricity bills.

title: Battle rages over treasure at 'most valuable shipwreck in the world'
description: Colombia and a US firm are fighting over a shipwreck in the Caribbean Sea that could be worth $18bn.

title: Conservative leadership: How does the contest work and who chooses the winner?
description: Party members will select the new leader, who will be announced on 2 November.

title: Policeman shot Chris Kaba dead fearing he would kill officers, court hears
description: A Met Police marksman is accused of the murder of Chris Kaba who was shot in a car in south London.

title: Melania Trump signals support for abortion rights
description: Her apparent support of abortion access puts her at odds with her husband, who has taken credit for helping to overturn Roe v Wade.

title: Burglar hung out washing and cooked meal for victim
description: The victim returned home to find her house broken into and a note left saying "be happy, eat up".

title: Cruise ship that was stranded in Belfast finally heads off to next destination
description: A cruise ship stranded in Belfast for the past four months has finally left the city's lough.

title: Disguised GP poisoned mother's partner in row over will, court told
description: He is accused of injecting his mother's partner with a poison while disguised as a community nurse.

title: Interest rate cuts could be more aggressive, Bank of England governor says
description: Governor Andrew Bailey hints that borrowing costs could come down faster if inflation stays in line.

title: Ex-teacher on bail for sexual assault sought work as private tutor
description: A man charged with sexual assault has been advertising as a private tutor for children, the BBC finds.

title: Download now
description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Iran, Israel and the Middle East crisis explained
description: How did we get here and what happens next?

title: Four Tory leadership hopefuls take the stage
description: Four MPs who hope to become the next Conservative leader had 20 minutes each to deliver a speech to conference.

title: Man held after acid attack on girl outside school
description: Teagan McFarlane, who is 14, remains in hospital with "potentially life-changing" injuries and has undergone surgery.

title: Man admits killing his mother in her home
description: Barry Noone, 47, had previously denied murdering his mother but has now admitted manslaughter.

title: Delivering safe care a challenge in Scotland's A&Es, doctor warns
description: The Royal College of Emergency Medicine warns that the government's winter planning is not doing enough.

title: Dangerous e-bike riders 'putting town under siege'
description: There are fears it is only a matter of time before somebody is killed by reckless e-bike riders.
